subject: RE: [junit] How to write a junitcode for the following code
msgSnippet: Would it be unethical to give a completely misleading answer, to punish the student who was too lazy to read the JUnit documentation and figure out his
messageBody:
Would it be unethical to give a completely misleading answer, to punish the student who was too lazy to read the JUnit documentation and figure out his homework for himself?

I was thinking of an answer along these lines:



Hi, sean197903,

Here's the JUnit test case for this class.

private String junitcode() {

System.err.println("Test has passed");

Test myTest = new Test();

myTest.insert(this.getClass());

return myTest;

}

It's probably homework, don't bother.

> --- sean197903 <sean197903@...> wrote:
> > //i can not find a test method
> > import java.util.Vector;
> >
> > public class Test {
> > int count = 0;
> > Vector list;
> >
> > public Test (int count) {
> > this.count = count;
> > this.list = new Vector ();
> > }
> >
> > public Test () {
> > this.list = new Vector ();
> > }
> >
> > public void insert (String item) {
> > if (count < 3) {
> > this.list.add (item);
> > count++;
> > }
> > }
> >
> > public boolean present (String item) {
> >
> > for (int i = 0; i < count; i++) {
> > String stuff = (String) list.elementAt (i);
> > if (stuff == item) {
> > return true;
> > }
> > }
> > return false;
> > }
> > }
> >
